definition: variant of 蹺|跷[qiao1]/to raise one's foot/stilts
to raise one's foot/to stand on tiptoe/stilts
variant of 蹺|跷[qiao1]/to raise one's foot/stilts
to raise one's foot/to stand on tiptoe/stilts
to catch sight of in a doorway (old)
board/plank/plate/shutter/table tennis bat/clappers (music)/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/accented beat in Chinese music/hard/stiff/to stop smiling or look serious

sentences.english: Because I can play the seesaw in the park.
sentences.chinese: 因为我能在公园里玩跷跷板。

sentences.english: The boy keeps the seesaw in balance.
sentences.chinese: 这个男孩儿让跷跷板保持平衡。

sentences.english: Simply by using your finger right here, it's like a little see-saw.
sentences.chinese: 只要把手指放在这里，就像是跷跷板一样。

sentences.english: You can see a seesaw in it.
sentences.chinese: 在花园里，你可以看到一个跷跷板。

sentences.english: their seesaws always went up,but they never came down.
sentences.chinese: 他们的跷跷板总是起来，但是从不下去。

sentences.english: The emperor passes decree, enrol emperor's son-in-law than seesaw.
sentences.chinese: 皇帝传旨，比跷跷板招驸马。

sentences.english: Their seesaws always went up, but they never came down.
sentences.chinese: 跷跷板一头压下去就再也起不来了。

sentences.english: The children often teeter in the park.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们常在公园玩跷跷板。

sentences.english: Much like a teeter-totter, one's life goes through periods of harmony and periods of difficulty.
sentences.chinese: 就象跷跷板，人生会经历和谐时期和困难时期。

definition: see-saw/also written 蹺蹺板|跷跷板[qiao1 qiao1 ban3]
swing (seat hung from a frame or branch)
merry-go-round/carousel/Carousel, South Korean TV soap opera
sandpit (for children's play or for long jump etc)/sandbox
tug-of-war/to take part in a tug-of-war
